text:
After discovering that Carlos' Kitchen closed the day before I got there, I scrambled to find somewhere else close by to get a burger recently. I remembered that a workout friend told me about a new place near our gym called Biscuits 2 Burgers so I thought I'd seek it out. They pretty much don't exist online still; no official website, no Yelp page, so I started driving west on Tropicana until I found it. Despite all of this, was my experience encouraging enough to keep this place around?

The restaurant is in a fairly new strip of retail on Tropicana and Grand Canyon, a lot of the spaces are still empty and this whole area is kind of quiet. Biscuits has a temporary (?) vinyl sign above the door that doesn't stand out too much; I can only hope they replace it with something better if they plan on sticking around. The interior is very open and clean with a large number of 2- and 4-top tables, as well as a high counter facing the kitchen area. The tagline on their menu is 'your neighborhood café', and it definitely had that feel during my visit; everyone knew the chefs while I was in there and they were all discussing each other's family members and things.

The menu is pretty small; one small page of breakfast items, and a handful of burgers and sandwiches. In an attempt to order something a bit neutral, I ignored the pastrami-topped burger, Philly burger and Hawaiian burger and went with a California burger with avocado, tomato and cheddar. There's also a note on the menu that 'all sandwiches are served with choice of chips or macaroni salad', but I was given the choice of skinny or fat fries which relieved me a bit. The burger had great quality meat; it was very flavorful and cooked close to medium rare. The bun was grilled and tasty, kind of the off-the-shelf backyard BBQ variety, and a bit too thin for this burger as it split into a few pieces about halfway through. The avocado was good, but do three slices of avocado turn a cheeseburger into a California burger? I guess so. The LTO were all decent, a bit too much lettuce maybe but that's easily remedied.

The fries were of the very generic frozen variety, but they were cooked very much to my liking of done to a bit over done so I was ok with them. Overall this was not bad at all, and certainly way better than Great Links which supposedly won some best burger contest in town. The place is cute; I hope it can have some staying power in a fairly empty retail development with poor signage and no advertising that I know of. It was also a good value for the money; my meal came to a fairly reasonable $9.19 with an iced tea. If you're in the neighborhood definitely come by to support these guys, I don't know if it would make it onto any of my must-have lists, but they get my approval.
Great bacon cheeseburgers and affordable prices. Nice simple breakfast for cheap. Definitely worth a visit. And nice customer service.

I just took my kids to this place and it was amazing! The biscuits were so fresh and the burgers were amazing.    Our waitress was Sandy and she was so entertaining.  
So if you go on the weekend ask for Sandy an order the biscuits.  You will not be disappointed

I have been to this place 1 time. We arrived as a party of 6. It was me, my mom, dad, husband, sister and Son. We LOVE BISCUITS AND BURGERS, so we had to try this. We went for dinner. 

We purchased the Groupon, we had never been here but definatly wanted to try it. We figured you couldnt go wrong with BISCUITS and BURGERS. My 3 year old son however only eats soup. 

My father and I both ordered the trump Burger, My son got the chicken tortilla soup, and my mother got a club. 

The trump Burgers WERE AMAZING. They were so amazing and a really good value. They were so big we could only eat half of each, we ended up taking a whole burger home. My son LOVED the soup. He even took some home and had it later in the night. Keep in mind my son DOES NOT eat leftovers, in fact this is the first and only time he has. 

Joe was our server, he was wonderful. He also cooked our burgers and we were able to watch him cook them, they were amazing. 

I cannot wait to try this place for breakfast. We will definitely be back. 

If you want a good burger, good service, and happy kids/toddlers this is a dinner spot everyone can agree on. 

Great job guys. YUMMY!

the ham steak and eggs was very good,fresh and I really like the choice of the sweet potatoes vs. White potatoes! I also understand that they make all of their waffles and pancakes fresh, from scratch! :) I'm going to try our NEXT time. very friendly service and the price is  right!

Came in for a late breakfast and since they have "biscuits" in their name, of course I ordered the biscuits & gravy. The jalapeño biscuit was surprisingly bland and the gravy had sausage in it but I could not taste it. 

It's a small spot and service is good. Maybe I'll go another time and try the burgers.
This place is my favorite breakfast restaurant ! I always get fresh quality food at a affordable price . The service is always great and Kim is the biggest sweet heart ! This place is a must try !
This place is absolutely the best breakfast spot. Kid friendly, great food chill ambiance.
I came here and they left a temporarily closed sign on the door. When do you open back up?

great omelets.  coffee is the worst.  hope that they change to a coffee that compliments their meals.

also, not so sure why bread or a biscuit, and especially a biscuit since that is their name, is a side order and not part of the meal???????

but again, breakfast was great.....except for the coffee and having to pay $1.50 for toast unless i didn't want potatoes???????
This place is delicious. Service is great, super clean, relaxed atmosphere. Food is amazing and the prices are unbelievably affordable. Great for families!!!

We went to Biscuits 2 Burgers today around 1:30 and were happily surprised.  Since it was a small restaurant in an inconspicuous area with a simple, vinyl sign, I did not expect too much.  However, I was immediately impressed when we walked in.  The clean, modern decor and fresh flowers on every table created an inviting ambiance that was accentuated even more by the friendly demeanor of our server.  After ordering, we were offered a fresh pastry while we waited for our food.  While we declined, it was still an appreciated gesture.  My boyfriend ordered the California Burger (avocado, tomato and cheddar on an 8 oz angus beef patty) and I ordered the City Sliders (goat cheese and caramelized onions on three 2 oz angus beef patties).  The food was simple, fresh and delicious.  My only criticism would be about the fries.  They were good, but they were obviously from the freezer, so they were nothing special.  We finished off the meal with a complimentary flan (which our server brought out since it was our first time eating there).  Overall a great experience, and we will be back to try the breakfast at some point soon.  The best part?  For an awesome meal with two entrees and one drink, our bill was only 16 and change.  Wow.  Come and try Biscuits 2 Burgers, and hopefully it will stay around for a while.
This place is right by my office. Staff is friendly, service is quick and food is good. Will recommend to everyone I know

Hopped in to Biscuits 2 Burgers on my lunch hour because of a recommendation from a co-worker that had a decent first time.  There were 3 of us and 2 other people in the place.  Before officially deciding on our lunch choices, our waitress brought over  a tray of baked goods.  My friend said in what I assumed was a statement / question, 'We get to pick one of these out?'  Our waitress just smiled and my 2 friends took a muffin each.  We then ordered our meals.  I would say it took about a half hour after ordering to receive our food.  Like I said there were 5 people total in this joint.  The food...average at best.  I went for the turkey burger, and I kid you not, the patty was just like the frozen patties you can find in any groceries freezer section.  Not fresh. And didn't really taste like turkey.  My friend got the 'Pancake Sandwich.' I couldn't wait to see this, it sounded amazing on the menu.  I kid you not again...it was 2 pancakes with an egg on top cooked however you like it.  The egg was 1/4 the size of the pancakes.  Didn't look a thing like a sandwich.  

Now for this last part I will take partial blame.  But I still cannot wrap my head around how it played out.  Right after our meal was over, I asked the waitress if she would mind splitting the bill 3 ways.  Honestly, how it went was 1 meal per person and 1 person had an iced tea, so I didn't feel too bad about this request.  THERE WERE 5 PEOPLE IN THERE!  She says ok and walks away.  Only to come back a minute later and say that the machine kinda fumbled up the amounts a little.  She went on to describe that 1 person has 1 meal, 1 person has 1 meal and 1 iced tea, the last person has 1 meal and 2 muffins.  The iced tea didn't go with the persons meal that ordered it and the muffins indeed were not an act of kindness, rather a ploy to spend more money, which is fine, except my friend in a round about way earlier had suggested that they were free and the waitress did not correct him otherwise.  Now he is stuck with paying for 2 muffins because the machine 'fumbled' it up. Karma I guess for thinking anything in this life would be free.  And just to mention also, those muffins were $1.50 each and no bigger then a kids fist.  Total rip off.  Not only was the turkey burger from the freezer section, but the muffins came from a Betty Crocker muffin mix bag in the Baking Needs aisle.  

Skip it....and believe when you walk in somewhere and it is more empty then full, there's a reason for it.
My favorite diner in Vegas! Try the breakfast burrito or New York style burger anytime!

Biscuits 2 Burgers is a great new breakfast/lunch spot.  They serve breakfast until they close at 3pm, and I like having breakfast for lunch.  They feature a different homemade biscuit everyday and we had cheddar biscuits the day we went.  I had the biscuit sliders with sausage and scrambled eggs and they were delicious.  It comes with a very generous side of hash browns which I couldn't even finish.  Another person at our table had the NY burger and loved it, so I may have to try that next time.  Prices were really reasonable and the service was good.  The owner/chef even came over and spoke with us for a few minutes, which was a nice touch.
Open kitchen concept, fresh baked biscuits, chicken and waffles were on point, service was good and food is made to order fresh. Great little place. Will be back!

I really enjoyed the cafe like atmosphere. A little small but very cute. Our server was very friendly and our order was taken quickly. I didn't care for the biscuits and gravy. The pancakes were good though. Overall I wasn't too impressed.

Just had a wonderful 5 course dinner on "Friday Date Night"  (offered every other Friday evening).  Everything was outstanding - fresh and perfectly prepared.   Very economical; best value in Las Vegas!

I was pleasantly surprised when I walked in.  Nice buildout, very clean.  I like that you can watch the chefs prepare your food right in front of you.  Food was solid.  Service was ok.  It was quite busy and our waitress was trying her best to accommodate everyone.   All in all im happy to have found a new breakfast go to close to home!
Customer service on point. The cashier is super nice so is the cook. The food doe. Just ahh-may-zing! I usually eat there for lunch every wednesday! Im never disappointed!
Best breakfast in the last four days we have been here.   It's worth the escape of the strip.  Don't forget the orange juice!!!!'

Food was ok, arrived mid morning only two people at the bartop another three parties on dining room tables and nobody greeting at the front door. took about 15 minutes to place an order. I ordered french toast with sausage took another 15 minutes.  While the food was good took a little too long for the environment.  sever never checked after food was dropped. sadly cant say I would go out of my way to pass ihop to go back there

We love this place and stop by for breakfast whenever we're on this side of town. The wait may sometimes be long, but the quality of the food is worth it. For those of you from the east coast, they have REAL taylor ham! 

We always get the biscuit sliders, and have yet to be disappointed. Eggs are always cooked to perfection, and no matter what their biscuit of the day, it's always delicious. We definitely recommend this place.

This place has the best orange juice in town! They also have whole grain options which I really liked. The waffle was a good size and was delicious. The waiter we had he was very attentive and nice, it was our first time trying this place but we will definitely be back!

Almost scratch kichen with very reasonable prices. Call ahead on Father's Day & they had a table waiting reserved for us. Will definitely return & try moee of the homemade green chili/cheddar biscuits.

The food is always a guaranteed delicious meal with a homemade feel...we are regulars and their breakfast menu always hits the spot. We tried the burgers for the first time and they are just as exceptional! The steak and eggs were spot on and by far they have the best fresh squeezed orange juice. A true hidden gem of west Las Vegas.

Biscuits 2 Burgers is fantastic! Magnificently decorated, impeccably clean,
with great parking and easy to find, (on West Tropicana between Fort Apache
and Hualapai), this restaurant has great food at very reasonable cost. Among
its many eating choices you will find hard to get Bison Burgers ($9.95), Apple,
Banana Nut, and Pumpkin Pancakes ($6.95 to $7.99)  and a great Burgers
selection. Biscuits 2 Burgers is as good as it gets!
Ok food,  not the best but for the price ok.  If you're hungry  on a budget, the breakfast special will fill you up. ...

I wanted to give this place a good review, it's close to my home - but it's just not there.
We went in for breakfast and to start off the coffee came out to us lukewarm and I had to ask twice for water.
I had a steak sandwich and my buddy had a Denver omelet.
Both were kind of small portions and my hoagie roll was a little hard.
We both found the food average at best or below.

When we left we both agreed that we found no reason to come back.

I hate writing reviews like this because I know it's hard to run a small breakfast business.
I hope they take this to heart - maybe they can turn it around because they seemed like nice people.

Great food reasonable prices. Must try their biscuits. Hmmmm good
When you order their burger ask to have the French fries mixed they have two kinds of fries and they complement the burger
Kudos
Great tasting food and a nice variety on the menu. If there are specials, go for them!

We stopped in around 6 p.m. It is very nice inside with an open kitchen. I had a burger and my wife had a New York steak sandwich. The special of the day was a free milkshake with any burger and fries. What a great deal! The waitress was friendly and attentive. The burger was huge and cooked just right! I have the sweet potato fries and they were excellent! We will definitely go back again!

This is a great little family restaurant.  We go there often, and love the fact that they have breakfast available all day.  They also have vegan, and gluten free meals.  the pancakes
are great, and the biscuits and gravy are to die for !!  Another favorite of mine is the pastrami
on rye sandwich, with many choices of cheese.  Try it with pepper jack, super good!  Their burgers are amazingly fresh, and juicy.  Probably the best burger I have had in a long time.
The food is cooked fresh to order so it takes a while to get to your table, but worth waiting 
for.  The service is excellent, and the waiter we have is very personable and polite.

My husband and I were looking for a late breakfast/early lunch spot and I remembered this opened by our house. 

I had their breakfast special, croissant sandwich with egg and bacon accompanied by seasoned potatoes. It was delicious! The croissant was big and toasted perfectly and the potatoes were fresh and seasoned just right, not too salty and not greasy. 

My husband got the New York burger which he said was very good. The party was huge and moist and the veggies were very fresh. He got skinny fries with it and those were cooked just right. 

Overall, we had a great experience. Our waitress was very nice and kept checking on us-she even offered us some pastries as we waited for our food. The chef/owner came to our table as well to see how everything was, which was very nice of him to do. We will definitely be coming back! 

Oh, they do close at 2:30 but have a Friday dinner event from 5-8:30.

Guests BEWARE, my advice if you dine here is PAY ATTENTION!!!! Food lines the kitchen counters that should be under refrigeration! Bacon & Sausage sits in a pan on top of the grill ALL DAY. Fresh squeezed OJ could be half fresh from machine and the rest from a picture from up to days juiced earlier! Iced Tea not brewed fresh daily!!!!

First, I would like to say that the service was excellent. The server was attentive and professional. I like that in a restaurant. However, the food was just OK. I had the biscuits and gravy. Honestly, the biscuits didn't taste freshly made and were a bit tough vs. light and fluffy. I really love biscuits and make them myself, so I'm picky and very rarely find good biscuits. The gravy wasn't bad and had good flavoring. I just wish they put a bit more on the biscuits because I had some biscuit left without gravy on it. It may have been because the gravy was too thick. The hash browns were pretty standard.

Got a breakfast sandwich and hash browns from here one day it was delicious. Only one guy cooking I appreciate that as a cook myself. Only one waitress though I felt a little bad for her but overall very good and very good food

Today I gave B 2B a try after a late morning work out.  Surprised they don't have a sign yet given the apparent money spent building out the kitchen  - all new with dominating stainless steel equipment.  the space reminds me of Mr. Mama, Eggs Cafe, norm's cafe, etc.  - relatively small dining room serving breakfast and lunch.

one other table occupied when i walked in around 10:30.  Straight forward menu - prices seem very reasonable.  I opt for the basic 2 egg breakfast with sausage - $5.50 ( pic attached )   since the place is called Biscuits 2 Burgers i figure i should try the biscuit so i ask for one with the meal.   The server asked if i wanted 2, if so, it's $2 more.  I ask,"  does the meal come with toast ?"  answer: you can also get toast with the biscuit.  I simply want a biscuit instead of toast.  "Ok"

Food took a while which surprised me since only one other table.  Even with one cook, how long does it take to warm up some sausage, fry up 2 eggs and potatoes and put a biscuit on a plate ?  Based on what i received, I'm guessing the delay was due to the potatoes - my guess they were cooked up fresh - if busier, they need to cut corners on the food prep - this can occur without sacrificing quality ( and yes, I've worked as a cook and I've owned a bar/grill so i know a few things ...emphasis on few ! ) 

The food was decent, somewhat unremarkable but i didn't have high expectations except when it came to the biscuit.  I figure a place called biscuit 2 burger will pride itself on their biscuits.  The biscuit was underwhelming - bummer !

Surprised to see a surcharge of .50 on my bill that can only be attributable to the biscuit.  I figure it's unlikely i'm returning to this place so i opted not to debate the surcharge.

wow what a dissapointment !  never will eat there again !  almost an hour for our food with 4 customers there !  warm drinks w no ice !  server moves at a snails pace!  i odered the hawian burger w griled onions med well  got a raw undercooked pink burger w raw onions ! i sent it back after waiting 55 mins and was told it would only take 20 more mins to make another one ! which made me laugh actually  ! save your time and money !!.
Great atmosphere,  solid service and even the chef in the open kitchen say hello to everyone and recognizes 80% of the guest. Keep that up B2B, im definitely coming back
Really nice restaurant. Went to dine in this morning with family. and received wonderful customer service from Joe. My picky son even enjoyed his food!!. Will definitely be back.

BEWARE Our first time coming here, and would not return. They had a nice server that was the host, a busier, kitchen helper and server all in one. I feel for the guy he tried his hardest. Now for the cook I think he was a rented cook, his jacket had an advertisement  of customcook.com, we looked it up and its a catering company. So upon walking in all the 4 seater tables were dirty, two were occupied and last clean one available for our party of 3. We got seated immediately. We are getting ready to order when we were notified they are out of biscuits, wait isnt the restaurant called biscuits 2 burgers. How could they be out of biscuits its in their name isn't it their specialty?  Its Tuesday morning at 11, not a saturday or sunday where I could understand possibly running out.  So the server informed us the biscuits were in the oven which would only be about 15 to 20 more minutes, ok no big deal we'll wait. Well 15 to 20 mins turned into an 1hour and 10 minutes and I'm not exaggerating. in the mean time a table has already walked out.  We finally got our food, my husband ordered the a poached egg slider it was extremely over done, was not runny at all, I ordered an egg over medium which was over hard, the bacon was under cooked, we couldn't handle this anymore so we had to walk out. I have never written a review nor ever walked out of a restaurant. Not mention the server told us he would only charge us for one entree when we didn't even touch any of them,  needless to say we didn't pay for anything. this place is a joke I was really looking forward to trying something new, It was a waste of an hour in half that I will never get back. Server stated 3 people quit on him today, this place needs needs new management, that cares and would be there to help in situations like this.

Ok I'm very pleased with my decision to try this little neighborhood cafe. Very cute cafe style set up, friendly staff and as for the food well delicious with impressive presentation. I ordered the city sliders with goat cheese and caramelized onions, which was absolutely divine!! I highly recommend more south Summerlin residents need to come out and give this local business a try!

Our food was drenched in salt... I couldn't finish my food. I frequent lots of off the strip dining and prefer the little places. That being said, even McDonalds don't mess up eggs. My girlfriend and I ordered omelettes, what we got was hard scrambled eggs with canned mushrooms and turkey bacon folded in the middle. Our food service was slow but our waiter was pleasant enough, for a Cardinals fan lol... If you have high blood pressure, this isn't your place. Try DW Bistro on Fort Apache... Never coming back here.

Home made biscuits, enough said! Seriously very good food. great service. 
our service was quite attentive. She was great in explaining everything to us. She was delightful. 
The food was great. I had a wonderful fluffy omelet. It was cooked perfectly. The potatoes  crispy which is how I prefer them. The biscuit was so fresh and full of flavor and flaky tenderness.
My husband love his biscuits and gravy.
We also shared a cheese Danish that was so light and moist. The cheese center was chilled which is how it should be. 
We are fans and will be back!

GREAT PLACE! This place deserves good business! They are still new and working out some kinks, but the food and atmosphere are great! The owner/chef came and chatted with us, after giving us 2 coupons for 2 for 1 breakfast. I love that you can see the whole kitchen so you know what's going in your food. Great fresh food!

Cool place that I have passed by many times on the way home from work. Finally tried it on Saturday. Cute little spot with fresh flowers on every table and friendly service. It was already noon, so we decided to order lunch, but the breakfast menu looked great.

I ordered the California burger with an over easy egg and my husband got the New York burger that had pastrami on it. Both of our burgers were cooked to perfection and tasted great! Biscuits 2 Burgers only uses fresh ingredients made to order and you could taste the difference. Also, the fries were skinny and crisp just how I like them. And the prices, amazing! I could not believe how cheap this place was for the quality of the food. They have a $3.95 breakfast special Mon-Thurs, such a steal!

They also have a Friday date night price fix meal with around 4 courses for around $20 a person. My hubby and I definitely want to try that out next. This spot is a winner and we will be back!

Absolutely wonderful!! Stopped in this morning for breakfast and was more than satisfied!! It was crowded and we could tell they were short staffed (just the chef and waiter) so we waited a bit. But the food was so delicious and the employees were more than friendly!!! Ordered the biscuit sliders and they were to die for!! And on our way out, they chef came outside to make sure we were satisfied with our meal! Service like this is hard to come by these days and the food was impeccable! Homemade everything! I can't wait to go back and try it for lunch!
Food is delicious. The breakfast burrito is delectable. Fried with melted cheese on top. Service was a bit slow, but the food makes up for it.
Deliciousness with a neighborhood feel.  Affordable with quality food items. Dedicated friendly service.

I was considering giving it four stars but there were things I think the restaurant can improve. I felt the food was good, I ordered the biscuit slider meal, but I was made to choose between chili biscuit or cheese biscuit, and was told there was no regular biscuit. I think the restaurant should have regular biscuits, it would make it a lot more pleasant for customers like me who wanted a plain biscuit with my sliders. Also they sell donuts, which I loved, but the donuts were dry and not what I was expecting. I would love for them to continue selling donuts, but it would be awesome if they sold Krispy kremes. That would've been awesome. And also when they offer donuts they need to advice you they're not free and what the price is. I'm thinking I'll come back again, this not a bad place.

We've been here twice now and while the 1st visit was decent enough for us to give it another shot, there will be no return visit.

The food is good enough- please don't misunderstand - but the service is AWFUL. With just 2 other tables to cover, our waiter left us sitting for 15 minutes with menus in front of us, no apologies, no water, NOTHING. When he finally got around to taking our order, he had to have us repeat it several times. When I asked what kind of yogurt they offered with the granola and yogurt on the menu, he said he didn't know and took another 5 minutes (literally) to come back and tell me strawberry. 

At the 45 minute mark, he came back and asked my husband what kind of cheese and how did he want his eggs cooked again.. he forgot (yet he wrote it down when he took the order?) I started to tell him if they hadnt started cooking yet to forget it, we would leave since all I had was a semi cold cup of coffee served to us). He told me they had, an obvious lie, as my dish of yogurt and granola didn't need cooking and he was asking about the eggs and went away again for another few minutes. 

All said and done, including paying the bill this quick breakfast took us over an hour. 

I know the frustration on the wait was exacerbated by the alternatively whining/screaming child at the table behind us, which isn't their fault, but still made the already bad experience worse (side rant - parents? If your kid is sick, KEEP THEM HOME! The women didn't apologize, but told the waiter during one of the 4 trips the kid and grandma took to the car to calm her down from the screaming temper tantrum, "no, shes not usually like this but she has a fever and doesn't feel well"  Seriously?)

I'm sorry to see a small business suffer but the owner needs to hire some help and make sure his customers are attended to. I'm generally a patient and forgiving person, and would have been fine if they employed even one basic customer service skill.

This is gonna be brutally honest.  It's always cold in here. The older guy cooking has great flavors but is slow as a snail. He needs to prep and hire a fast short order cook. This place is very very inexpensive so I know they're not making as much profit as they should. Don't save on the heating bill just raise the price on some of your items to make up the difference.  People will pay for good food as long as they don't have to wait to long.  If they don't get a faster cook I'm sorry to say it but this place too will be gone.

Small little local place. The staff was great. The menu small and simple but good food! Can't beat the prices either. 

I made my own biscuit sliders and they were so good! They are 100% homemade and you can tell! 

My husband ordered the biscuits and gravy. Same biscuits but the gravy was eh... He definitely liked my meal better. 

Overall well definitely be back! I love supporting locally owned business vs chain places.


I've been back multiple times since and they never disappoint.
Love the menu. Breakfast and burgers. California burger medium well please. Fresh squeezed orange juice and fresh fruit. I'm loving it!
Breakfast very good, super friendly people inside, they have some good deals during the week.  Would definately recommend.
Its the difference between a cook and a chef personally preparing your meal along with the smile of an Angel server delivering to your table.

Had a group of 7 for dinner here.  I can't express how delicious it was. They over special dinners every few weeks.  It was $20 per person and included appetizer, soup, salad, entree, dessert and drink! Foot was prepared to perfection.  More like a five star restaurant.  I highly recommend this place. Chef Joe is passionate about his food too.
Only thing bad was the waiting time for the food granted I was a part of a party of six but the food was great!

Nice neighborhood breakfast spot. Went on a Saturday morning, not crowded and easy to get a seat. Staff was friendly and prompt. They have a fresh orange juice maker which is always a crowd pleaser. I ordered the 3 egg omelette. The veggies and cheese weren't  melted or cooked and the eggs were very greasy. How do you mess up something as simple as eggs?  I'd return and perhaps try something else on the menu.

Don't go here. I was just here for 30 min and they didn't even take my order. We waited 20 min to ask for an orange juice. We had to flag someone down to take our drink order and when I asked to order food, she said she only takes drinks but the other server takes their food order. He never came to our table or even looked at us. When we asked to leave because we didn't want to wait any longer for absolutely no service, the server said we had to wait at the register to pay or even get change for a $5 so we could pay for the darn juice.. They're lucky my boyfriend even left $5 on the table. I have never in my life walked out on a restaurant like that before. I understand you're busy, it's Sunday, but if you're going to seat someone you should be prepared to at least serve them. This happened today, April 26, 2015, between 10:45AM and 11:15AM. I do not recommend this place if you actually want to eat.

Since my boyfriend and I both love biscuits and gravy we had to try this place out. Very friendly staff, cozy atmosphere and delicious food! We had the green chili and cheddar biscuits and gravy, scrambled eggs and pancakes. Wayyy too much food but it was all on special and all of it was delicious (especially the biscuits!) 

We left here telling all of our friends and family about this place and couldn't wait to come back! If only it was a little closer to our house.... But it's worth the drive.

The food was great! But man the WAIT! (Rhyme was intentional) Please only come here if you have some time to spare in your day, i tried to squeeze this place in for a quick work lunch break, so my irritation took over a bit because they took soooooo loooooongggg on everyyyythinggggg theyyyy diiiiiidddd.

Thankfully when we finally got our food it was very good or you may have saw a forced 1-starER up there. I got the biscuit sliders with a side of gravy the biscuits were made of their Green chili and cheddar "biscuit of the day" it was real down home comfort food, super tasty. The side of potatoes were very delicious as well, crispy on the outside and soft on the in while perfectly salted. Side of gravy was also better than most places. All in all great food but is it worth the WAIT? I'm undecided.

My guy and I stopped in today (Sunday) he had to be at work before nine so we thought we should skip the bigger and busier places.  He had been here before dor a dinner take-out which was good so we figured we would give it a shot. 

The restaurant wasn't busy (I honestly think if it were more visable the place would be busier) which we didn't mind at all.  We could chat and leisurely eat without tables full of screaming mimis. 

To start he ordered a coffe (one of the best restaurant coffees either of us had tired) and I ordered a cranberry juice.  I was plesantly surprised to see a huge glass as opposed to those tiny juice glasses most places have and expect you to pay for refills. 

On to the food...we are both biscuit and gravy addicts so thats what we got.  It comes with potatoes which I asked for extra crispy ones, and that's exactly what I got. 

The server was plesant and attentive.  When we asked about the Friday date night, he took the time to explain it in detail. 

In short, yummy food cooked fresh (if I wasnt so vertically challenged I could have seen over the counter and watched meal being made), great service,  relaxing atmosphere.  I spied a few more things on the menu I would like to try, so I'm sure we will be back!
Food was delicious! Adorable cute little spot! Our waitress Kim was super sweet and amazing! Will definitely come back
Sliders with sausage and cheddar awesome!!!!!    Love this place come get yummy food!   Tuesday-friday breakfast special for 3.97!!!!!!

Sat down and the first thing I noticed was how good everything smelled.  Ordered a fresh squeezed orange juice, and also ordered a water, since I'm used to tiny little shot glasses of orange juice at other places.  Instead I got a huge (20+oz?) glass of delicious orange juice squeezed right in front of my by a futuristic robotic juicer.

Things only got better after that.  I got the build your own omelette with bacon avocado and pepper jack.  This may be the best omelette I've ever tasted.  The eggs were incredibly fluffy, and the inside was stuffed FULL of ripe delicious avocado.  I also tried a side of the southern style biscuits - crispy but dense, and delicious with honey.

This is the type of place where the ingredients are fresh and the food is clearly a labor of love.  It's so refreshing to visit a restaurant driven by passion rather than purely profit motive.  Biscuits 2 Burgers is definitely going to find it's way into my lunch rotation.

I wish I could rate this higher. Along with most of you, I love supporting local restaurants and businesses - especially if it's a breakfast joint. However, while the food was decent, nothing about my experience really stood out. 

Walking in, my friend and I were the only ones in there, except for one person seated at the counter about to leave. I wasn't sure whether the lack of customers was because the food was bad or simply because it was late morning on a Thursday. 

I ended up getting the breakfast sliders, due to many good reviews of it here on yelp. Yes the biscuits were fresh, and yes they were good. But overall, the dish was just meh. My sausage was super oily and the potatoes were underseasoned. As for my coffee? Super burnt, which is usually a huge indicator that it's just been sitting on the warmer for quite some time. It was completely and utterly undrinkable. 

Sad to say, I probably wouldn't recommend this spot next time my friends and I are trying to find somewhere to eat. But, if any of them want to try it, I wouldn't be opposed to giving it a second chance.

I was planning on taking pictures but when the food got to the table it looked SO GOOD everyone dived in. 

This place is so cute and affordable. The service is absolutely phenomenal. We were treated as though there wasn't anyone else in the place. The drinks came within maybe 2 minutes of being sat (and kept full throughout the meal). There wasn't anything on the menu over $10. My son got a huge chocolate chip Belgium waffle ($4.95), my husband got a bowl of Texas style chili (chunky and thick, was not bulked up with beans; it had onions, peppers, and big chunks of cheese to stir in, with a homemade yeast roll) ($5.25), and I got a Hawaiin burger platter (Angus beef, pineapple, thick cut bacon, and I added an egg for $0.95, for a total of $8.90). Joe, our server, was very attentive and most importantly, he spoke to our 7 year old like a person - made eye contact, took his order, asked him how his food was, etc. 

I plan on going back soon to try out a breakfast!

Joe was our server & he was on top of every little detail.  Kept the coffee cups filled and The nicest guy! He makes the restaurant more desirable with his pleasant demeanor. 

The food was exactly as ordered... Medium Rare was exactly medium rare.  The black coffee was tasty and not bitter at all. 

A great detail on the Caesar salad is the fried Parmesan bowl. It added a nice flavor! 
*** To add chicken it was only $1.50 which was totally worth it.  

The goat cheese burger was very good.  The onions come out sautéed .  If you want caramelized I Think you need to mention it.  The menu says caramelized, but either way it was very nice. 

We also had the South of the Border burger. The onions are raw, if you want grilled you need to ask & they seem to be very happy to give you what you ask for. 

Fries are fresh & crispy.  Biscuits are fresh... Orange juice is fresh squeezed. 

Things are not heavily seasoned so if you want more seasoning you will want to ask. 

Great neighborhood Family place!

I stopped in this morning, to find one of the absolute best bowls of homemade oatmeal & lemon poppy seed muffins (short of Mom's) that i've ever had! Joe the owner was very polite and friendly, as was my waiter. I will definitely be stopping back in to try more of Joe's good homemade cooking!
Why didnt we come here sooner!? Great decor, clean, friendly, great food. Could use more  kids food choices and kid-friendly cups. We'll be back very soon!

One of my coworkers that enjoys food recommended this spot near his house. He lives on the same side of town as me. So we talk about food and so far we have both steered each other in the right direction comes to new spots. I was looking for someplace new was in the area and remember about Biscuits 2 Burgers. 

Other yelpers have mention it. It was more ghetto before then put up permanent sign (one that really cool, nice logo not just words of the restaurant but screams personality). The outside never believe the type of establishment find once open the front door. The area itself really nothing else much open in that small shopping area and most of the other spots are empty or feels like ghost town. Like I said once you walk in be surprise! It had nice clean, totally new restaurant look, and really nice small cafe feel for me. Each table have fresh flowers something that you hardly see in restaurants. It very much open air feeling between the open kitchen, the country decor, and one of the big artwork or art on the wall. It plate with two eggs and smiley bacon strips. Great saying that I forgot. =((( The lady that was hostess/waitress was fabulous from the get go. Friendly. Answered any questions I had about the menu. Good fun talking stories with her. I was the only one in the restaurant. 

I decided on breakfast (I do plan on coming back again for lunch). I had the banana nut pancakes with side of turkey bacon (it comes with sausage or bacon; craving turkey bacon so cost more). Talk about nice portion. Not that I love my go to breakfast spots where the pancakes portions sizes enormous. It was refreshing change look at the plate have three decent size pancakes with nice toppings and presentation had clean simple look. The taste was great! The pancakes was right between dense and fluffy. I like. The turkey bacon on the side was nice crispy and delicious. I also ordered the fresh orange juice. Yelpers that good call!!! The juicer machine thought was pretty cool looking in the kitchen. Just observation. It does the good that for sure. It tasted fresh, not concentrated, or juice get at buffet or any hotel restaurant out of gallon jug. The whole meal for me was fabulous. I look forward to trying the lunch menu and the burgers.

If in the area not doubt place would recommend! No doubt with Biscuits 2 Burgers never judge book by it cover. Believe it.
Burgers are great!!!!  This visit was our first time but we will be back. Nice place for breakfast or lunch.

Love this place for breakfast. I'd come for the fresh squeeze orange juice but I can't skip the breakfast burrito... Best I've had. The other breakfast items are all delicious as well. Sometimes service can be slow if it gets busy... But I think we are low maintenance so it's okay :)

I love this spot! The food is awesome and I have been here many times for lunch and breakfast and everything has always been spot on. It's sometimes slow, but it's because they make everything fresh for you right then and it's worth the wait! It's also super affordable.

This place was great! We were the first people there at 8 am, but it is a cozy little diner. The pancake sandwich was good, the sausage was tasty, but the real deal was the biscuit sandwich with fresh squeezed orange juice to wash it down! So tasty.

Pretty good for the price

My favorite breakfast place in the neighborhood. I know the staff well after all my visits they call me by name. I'm here twice a week for breakfast or lunch. I recommend the biscuits but everything is great. The key to this place is that everything is made from scratch including the sauces that come with the food. The customer service is excellent and the prices are super reasonable. The lowest prices in this area by FAR. Go to original house of pancakes your paying for every single thing A la carter.. ok I think the bastards even charge for butter and syrup separately 47 dollars for a two person meal. My cousin and I were at biscuits to burgers the other day had breakfast for 19 bucks out the door. Better quality then the competition and at a realistic price. The place is never too crowded that you don't get the proper attention from the staff and you won't be waiting outside for 30 minuets like at OHP.

I must admit we never did breakfast at Biscuits2Burgers.  We hear their breakfast is awesome!!!  We were in Vegas for a week of fun and found the place on a lunchtime walk along Tropicana Ave.  The "biscuit" part of their out-front sign encouraged us to stop in for lunch.  Wow!! Their home-made soups are to die for.  Jane had the Black Bean soup and I had the Carrot Apple Ginger soup.  We were sharing spoonsful with each other; incredibly flavorful, well seasoned and the textures were sooo homemade. Yum! And they make great Fresh Fruit Smoothies from scratch, too.  

I had the Black Bean burger (I'm not vegetarian, either).  It was magnificent.  Appropriately crisp on the outside, succulent and richly flavored on the inside.  AND, I had it served on one of their wonderful biscuits.  Jane has a Salad with Grilled Chicken. She loved it.  Lunch was a total Yum!! 

We were so impressed, we returned two days later to try other lunch menu items.  We must have talked about the Biscuits2Burgers food so much that our entire party of five returned to have a marvelous lunch there on our last day in Vegas.

The restaurant crew was so courteous and friendly, we felt comfortable to linger and totally enjoy their hospitality... and their very special food. Don't miss this family-owned treasure!!
Food was good, friendly & quick service. Prices are very reasonable & the freshly squeezed orange juice was great. Will definitely go back soon.

Decided to try this place out since it's close to our house.  It's a small restaurant with a nice homey feel to it.  The menu is pretty basic.  We ordered omelets and toast, but they also serve burgers and other non breakfast foods.

Overall the food was tasty and hot.  Nothing really to complain about.  Prices are very reasonable.

The reason it's not 5 stars is because, in my opinion, a 5 star rating says there is something uniquely special about the business that makes it stand out.  This place, although good, is just a normal place with food that can be found almost everywhere.  Again, not knocking the place down at all.  Definitely recommend it, just don't expect to be "wowed" by it.

If a restaurant uses the word Biscuits in its name, the biscuits it serves should be exceptional.  I had breakfast here a couple of weeks ago, and the biscuit that accompanied my omelet was awful.  Fortunately, the omelet was well-prepared, and the service spot-on.  Granted, I grew up in the part of this country where biscuit-making is an art form, and my grandmothers set high standards with their versions, but this biscuit wasn't even close to the frozen ones at my grocery.  Maybe the burgers are better?

Literally eating the breakfast now that I just ordered 20 minutes ago. The chef does a great job. Very reasonable pricing and everything is made from scratch. I'm eating the breakfast sliders with pepper jack and sausage and potatoes covered in gravy. I highly recommend for $6.75. And the fresh squeezed oj though simple is delicious. Chef found out I had a kid at the house and threw in a free doughnut with sprinkles. Very nice guy. More people need to go here so we can keep local gems like this one around!!!

Awesome home cooked meals! Quality and value is the best in town. Don't let it's inconspicuous location fool you. $2.97 breakfast specials are you kidding me! Give yourself extra time though or if your in a rush don't come here. This is a one chef, one server place.

This entire restaurant consist of one waiter. And hostess who will seat you. And two chefs behind the grill. Long waits, poor service. Left before we could even order. I would have loved to try the food but this ruined my desire to ever go back. The lack of structure the staff has is bad, (having to wait over 20 min to even get a drink and no sign of the waiter to take our order). 

In my opinion hire some more people. Or don't seat people unless you're ready to serve them.

Boyfriend had the pastrami burger, and I ordered the verse your own omelet and might have gotten a little over excited and ordered the build your own biscuit sliders and the chili............ 

Nothing disappointed. Boyfriend said pastrami was delicious as was the burger patty itself. Didn't have too much of the omelet but the biscuit sliders were to die for. We had them with bacon, cheddar, and over easy eggs. SO FREAKING DELICIOUS. The biscuits are green chili and cheddar. Savory. Moist. Buttery. I want more. Seriously. Come for breakfast AND lunch!!!!!!!!
The hands down best deal in town. The BEST biscuits and gravy in town without question (I have been to 15-20 breakfast places in town)! I would give these guys 6 stars if I could!!!!

I have been here for Breakfast 2 times and 1 time for Lunch which was today. I like the home town feel that this restaurants gives with all retro pics of old Vegas and other locations. It's kinda cool. 

For Breakfast I've had the steak and eggs twice. The steak comes with 2 eggs, 2 pieces of toast and a choice of hash browns or fries. Both times my steak was nice and juicy just how I like it. Very satisfying. 

For Lunch I had the California Burger with avocado and sweet potatoes fries. The California Burger was so delicious that I'm thinking about going back again tomorrow for lunch. This burger is mouth watering Delicious!!  
I was thrown back on how great my meal was today. 

Our server Joey was great and got us what we requested within a timely manner. All the past server's have been personable and quite friendly. All of them have done a really job providing great customer service. I appreciate that. 

The cooks seem to take personal pride with the food that they cook and it defiantly shows it.

The name got my attention, so I bought a groupon. I stopped in for lunch, it's a nice location & easy to park. When I walked in I was greeted, seated & got the menu. It's a very clean relaxed place with cool decor, you can even see the chef cooking! The menu was plentiful with a variety of delicious items! I had the turkey burger with sautéed onions, mushrooms, sweet potato fries & a smoothie! Everything was cooked to perfection, quite delightful

Let me first start by saying that the outside does not do this place justice. I was hesitant to go in but I'm glad I did. They need a new sign... 

The inside is MUCH more appealing. Beautiful floors, clean open faced kitchen. The first thing to catch my eye was the fresh squeezed OJ machine. Yes please!

We ordered:

Egg croissant sandwich $3.97 Tuesday-Friday 
Are you serious? A steal. Two eggs on this bad boy, thick bacon (choice) pepper have cheese (choice) the fact that there are a few different options makes me eager to come back.

Homemade biscuits and gravy $3.97 Tuesday-Friday ... So good, nice flavor and the biscuits are most definitely made in house, incredible.

And to top off the experience, our server was pleasant and spoke professionally. I appreciate this type of service, regardless of where it is you work professionalism is appreciated. Thank you!

I'll be back. 


***UPDATE: we came back with the kids. And the kids cheeseburger is a joke for the price, literally the size of my palm. I recommend ordering a normal burger and splitting it. Other than that I feel like the prices are good for the amount of food you get.
Ordered corn beef and cabbage and it was like corn beef jerky.  They grilled it dry.  What a waste of money.

Another outstanding brunch at this hidden gem. Amazing whole wheat waffle, perfect hash browns and tasty sausage and bacon.  You have to check it out and Chef Joe is super friendly as are the entire staff.

Just listening to Chef Joe's Creature feature  menu for the October 25th date night. I wish we were going to be in Las Vegas that night, if you are, you should call now for reservations. It will be a Spooktacular evening - costumes are encouraged.

It's hard not to root for this neighborhood breakfast spot.  In Feb they had weekday (Tues to Fri) breakfast specials for less than 4 dollars.  You can get waffles, pancakes, or French toast paired with eggs for less than what you would pay at Denny's.  The food is not elevated, high-end cuisine by any means but for the value you're getting a great home cooked breakfast.  The biscuits were also definitely good paired with the gravy.

The reason I can't give it 4 or 5 stars is based on service.  Now typically I don't really care about service as long as it's not horrible and if I get good food. If service were better I d give it 4 stars tops.  We came on a Sun with only one other table.  The server couldn't multi-task worth sh1t and neither could the cook who was apparently working his first shift.  They were nice though I have to say.

If I lived closer I would frequent more often and may come to find that this visit was an outlier to what type of service you would expect and thus my rating would be higher.  

If you're in the area - check this place out. You really can't beat the value - no item is over 9 dollars with most items being 5-6 dollars.  My guess is this is more along the lines of 4 stars but I came on a bad day.
just heard you guys shut down. broke my heart. i used to order sides of gravy with everything. what am i going to do with my life...

I have never had such a bad review to write I almost feel bad. Setting the scene, we came this morning (Sunday) around 12:30/1 with about 9 people for breakfast after a wedding. Immediately we could tell we overwhelmed their small restaurant. 
We expected a bit of a wait and whatnot. Unfortunately even with relatively minimal expectations this was a disaster. 
Our drinks came out scattered and the waiter couldn't remember who asked for what and we had to ask for water and refills more than once before they arrived. 
They brought food out basically one or two at a time. I can't imagine why 3) of the same items came out basically half an hour apart.... This fiasco of disorganization made it so that by the time the first person finished eating, the last of us at the table were just being served. 
Also, my issue is that with the name of this place, the biscuits were cold and somewhat stale and the sliders were over cooked. 
Also we saw the Executive Chef/ Owner reading tickets and not cooking a damn thing just watching. I understand you have to train people if that was indeed the case but why would you do that when you have a large party. 
Overall we were quite disappointed.

Came here for breakfast on our first visit. Outstanding from start to finish. The space is very clean and nice. Kitchen opens to the dining area and is very clean and professional. I had a two egg breakfast with home style potatoes and ordered a biscuit and gravy side. The biscuit was green chile and cheddar biscuit and was delicious. All the food was great. Prices are tough to beat. Excellent breakfast spot and I will definitely be back for lunch sometime soon.

This place gets 2 stars only because the food was pretty tasty. The service was terrible and no one who worked there seemed to mind. We waited almost an hour for our food even though there were only a few other tables there. We were also seated in the corner of the breakfast bar directly in front of a giant oozing chocolate syrup container (so appetizing!) The waitress did come by several times to refill coffee but at no point did she apologize for the extremely long wait. She also didn't at any point clear the five or so tables that had already left, so we had to look at that the whole time, in addition to the chocolate syrup in my face. Also, a couple who came in half hour after us got our food at the same time we did. When the food finally came it was good (biscuits and egg sandwiches,) but so not worth the wait.

Good food, a simple menu and friendly staff.  This is my kind of breakfast spot.  I like to come in and eat slowly while reading a book.  They never rush me and keep my coffee hot.

Make your own biscuit sliders, the food is good, almost like a home cooked meal.  It's quiet in here as well so I get a chance to relax and clear my mind.  They always bring a pastry tray by, all made fresh in house.  I finally gave in today and had one of the best donuts I can remember.

Just ate here for the first time today.. Although my order didn't quite come out the way I had asked the staff went out of their way to correct the minor mistake..  They went as far as to make me a whole new order on top of the one I had already started to eat even though I had insisted it was totally fine.. They have a friendly staff and the rest of my party really enjoyed their meals.. Everything tasted awesome they just weren't warned by the picky eater (ME), but I left there stuffed and completely satisfied!!

Totally recommend Biscuits  2 Burgers!!

I always pass by this place when I go home and I finally decided to try it for breakfast...now this is my new breakfast spot! Challah French toast is so good! The bacon taste like they smoked it which was delicious! I'm going to come here to try the burgers next time!

I am stuck between 3 & 4 stars. I have nothing bad to say about the customer service ! They are very fast and sweet in there.
Now, the price is not bad.... but I feel they buy their food from the $1 store. Eggs have NO FLAVOR.
Pastrami tastes like the $.88 buddig sandwich meet.
Nothing special about it. Pumpkin waffles smelt amazing... but had no flavor. 
Again. Great service. Cheap prices. But I could cook this meal for myself with flavor.

This was quite possibly the best omelet I've had in a very long time.  Not many ingredients but somehow it was flavorful and amazing!  They also have this machine that both slices and juices the oranges for the orange juice, so it really is fresh squeezed unlike other places that make that claim and are really giving you Tropicana with some pulp in it.  I will definitely be back.

This is our go-to spot for breakfast on the weekends. It is close to our house and they offer a great breakfast specials during the week. On the weekends we usually get the biscuit sliders and those tend to be good. During the week, I usually get the croissant sandwich special-Croissant egg sandwich with potatoes on the side for 3.97. It is a good deal.

Stopped in for dinner after driving by several times. We ordered the steak dinner special and a plate of three giant city sliders and an excellent  Caesar salad. I asked for no salt on the fries which was no problem. We both enjoyed the food and it's a nice spot for breakfast lunch or an early dinner.

Great food, slow service, the place was less than 1/2 full but still the service was extremely slow, i watched the waitress walk back to the kitchen 12 times to carry plates to a table carrieing 1 plate at a time.

I like this place and it's been on my bookmark for quite some time. When we arrived, we were greeted immediately by a gentleman. He was also our server as well. He was so nice and sweet. They had a 3.95 special so, I took advantage of that and ordered the 2 eggs special with hash browns and sausage patties. My bf ordered the French toast made with challah bread and the 2 eggs with bacon. We also ordered the freshly squeezed OJ. For only 3.95 for each plate it was pretty darn great! We left satisfied, full and happy. Why would you go anywhere else and pay more and get the same type of food for mediocre taste? Plus, it looks like a small little business. I'm always happy to support small businesses.
This place is amazing love it !! The food is always fresh . The staff is friendly worth the money every cent .

Tried this place one morning right as they opened. Let me preface by saying that there was nothing special to me about this place. It was a good solid breakfast. For the price I would go to Cracker Barrel and get a the same thing plus there extras like bread, gravy and the such. The eggs were cooked to order and the bacon was crisp. It was just okay. If I was by it and hungry I would probably stop in again. But not a destination for me.

Some nice items and some things needing improvement. My husband and I ate here. The burger was ok,  the turkey burger however was one of the best flavored I've had in town. The regular fries were pretty good, the sweet potato fries were not as tasty and were coated in a sugary seasoning. As I'm a lover of sweet potato fries and order them often at resturants when available, I've had much better elsewhere. The pickles, unfortunately, were soggy...I mentioned it to the owner (along with complements of items we liked), however the response was somewhat abrasive. He conveyed that it wasn't a 'store bought like vlasic' as he assumed I was used to, but a 'family recipe'. Little did he know that I grew up with my family members making home made pickles, that I Love pickles and specifically look for home made ones in little shops as we frequently travel, and frequent several restaurants in town that make their own as well. Pickles that are home made can still have a crunch, some of it depends on the type of cucumber chosen. That being said, it was more of the tone of the response that was off putting.  We said we'd come back to give it another try, as we like supporting small businesses and local restuarants. The second time, I had larger group and we were going to go. We arrived at restuarant and saw sign out front advertising 'Trump Burger'. We frequent small businesses many of various political views, however we value them keeping that out of their business and making their establishment welcome to all. We had a diverse group that did not feel comfortable patronizing the establishment. We went to another local owned place and had great food and service.

I've been wanting to go try a new breakfast place in town and finally convinced the bf to take me there. We started off by walking in and the place looked clean for some yummy fresh Oj but then came down to the food. They had sweet potato hash brown's on the menu and we were like that's new let's try that. Well they ended up bringing us sweet potato fries and the waiter laughed and was like I'm sorry cook thought fries, then was like do you still want the hash? We were like yeah. As we waited I ate my waffle which were ok but I think they could have used better bread to make them yummier, the sausage patties where ok but still think McDonald's has better sausage patties. (Which I thought was sad) Anyways almost done with our meal and finally got the Hash brown's which to me those were not hash browns but more like sweet potatoes cut in big chunks and thrown in the fryer. So I'm rating this place 2 stars, 1 for clean and neat and 1 on food and service since they only had 1 other table occupied you would have thought are food would have been correct the 1st time around.

I love this place! The breakfast sliders come on freshly made biscuits and they have fresh squeezed OJ. Better than all that is their waitress Kim. She is personable and funny and makes the experience that much better.

This place was very interesting. 

The food was decent, but I didn't like the way they did the biscuits and gravy. It was just different to me I guess. The hash browns to me weren't hash browns in the traditional sense they were more like square cut fries. 

On the other hand I did try some of the egg's that my dining partner had along with the egg's and they were both excellent. 

We will return here as my Dr's office is just down the street maybe my review will change.

Had breakfast there this morning with my brother and nephew.  I had the egg white omelette with turkey bacon, onions and mushrooms and it was very good.  My brother had Belgian waffles and my nephew had the sausage sliders. Both enjoyed their meals as well.  Pricing was very reasonable and our server was very nice.

I love there food, but the wait.....The long long long never ending wait for food. I honestly can't tell if the food is good or if I'm so starved and on the verge of fainting that when I get my food I inhale it out of sheer animal instinct. I have been here many times and the service is just terrible every time, it takes 30 min for the sorry to take our parser and another 40 for the chief to make outer food even if were the only ones here. I'm sitting here waiting for my food as I'm writing. 

Im eating a fruit leather as obviously as I can becuase I legit my pass out and still no rush in service.... 

Heres my tip, eat before you come so your hungry when you get your food.

Cute place!! Met my aunt here for brunch and had their French toast and a mango smoothie. Very delicious! Would definitely go back again. The only thing is I guess their dog friendly?? There were 2 dogs in the diner while we were eating.

Came here for my daughter's birthday breakfast. The service was great. The food was good for the price. Although I felt my veggie omelette was a bit small and they ran out of the sweet pot hash I opted for slice tomatoes. My husband had the steak and eggs and the steak was ok kinda small as well. Although the kids meal was bigger than my adult entree. Over I would come again.

We live right down the street from this place and finally made it in today!!  I had the California burger...it was great!!  Very fresh ingredients and nice and juicy!  Had it with sweet potato fries again very good!  My boyfriend had an omelet which was almost as good.  Our waitress indicated they will be extending their hours to include dinner eventually which we are really looking forward to!

Bought a Groupon & decided to give this place a try. Albert was our server & he was great! When ordering he mentioned the chicken waffles was the best. So, we decided to try & also ordered the BYO biscuit sliders. The biscuit sliders were ok, decent. The chicken & waffles were fantastic! Chicken was moist, loved the light breading & waffles were tasty too! The breakfast potatoes were so good!! Great seasoning. We will definitely be back!

Joint is clean and fresh. Not overrated other places you have to wait for 30-75 mins just to eat breakfast. It took us less than hour, good service fills up your coffee every 10 mins friendly atmosphere . Veggie omelette was awesome , bacon were super crisp and were made fresh unlike other places were they sit under the warmers. Will definitely come back
This place is closed. Paper sign indicates it's temporarily closed, but it seems to be permanent.

I don't see what the good reviews are for.  INCREDIBLY long wait for our meals (30 min, when the place was not busy/full) and very slow service.  The food was lackluster.  CANNED mushrooms in my omelet, and small portions.  The gravy was tasteless, unless you enjoy the taste of flour.  "Fancy" biscuits might be good with dinner, but not at breakfast.

My husband enjoyed his Hawaiian burger, though.  Don't think we'll be back to try again.

Decided to try this place out while on my way home, drove passed it and also saw it on yelp. When I got there I was the only person there, aside from a man sitting at the bar waiting on a to go order. I ordered from the breakfast menu, found it to be limited, but not a problem. I ordered the biscuit sliders, and when I was told they only had the jalapeño cheddar biscuits I was somewhat disappointed seeing that they have "biscuit" in the name of the restaurant, yet don't even offer plain ones? Odd if you ask me. The biscuits were just ok, not bad, but ok. The home fries I was told were cooked with green peppers as well, yet when I got them they were just plain potatoes...the orange juice was the highlight of my meal. Best fresh squeezed orange juice that I've had. The cook came over and asked how my meal was (which I found to be very nice). The server was also very nice, yet when it started getting a little busy I realized he was the only waiter, and took about 15min for him to come back over after he had dropped off the check (only because I stopped him to come over. Overall it was good, but I think it could definitely be better if they give it a little more love.

Biscuits are great. Service with a smile was great. Coffee was a bit on the strong side, which reminded me of military coffee. 10 packets of sugar and 2 things of creamer later and then I could finally drink the coffee. The decor was nice and up to date. Fresh squeezed orange juice was refreshing.

I stopped here for breakfast yesterday morning partway through my Sunday morning bike ride.  I was here just before 8 AM and they weren't yet open.  Promptly at 8, the door opened and I was shown in.  I was told to sit anywhere.  The first thing I noticed was what a nicely decorated restaurant it was.  It was a sushi restaurant that closed which explains the large amount of bar seating and the food prep going on behind the counter.

I ordered the special of the day which was a breakfast croissant with 2 eggs cooked the way you want, two sausages or two slices of bacon--your choice--and your choice of cheese.  It also came with breakfast potatoes they called hash browns.  They're really not hash browns but they were very good potatoes.

Everything was very good.  My coffee was refilled quickly.  Angel, the server, was very pleasant!  I asked her about the Date Nights they're having and she explained and gave me a copy of the menu from their first anniversary Date Night dinner.  Normal date night dinners are $16.95 and you can call to get information about the menu and pricing.  

Angel brought a case with pastries--doughnuts, cupcakes, etc--and at first I thought she was offering a complimentary one.  When she told me the price, I then knew they weren't freebies.  It wasn't something I wanted with breakfast and since I was riding my bike, I didn't want to take any along to get damaged as I rode along.

I'll come back here because I do have to try something with a biscuit.

Quaint little tucked away place serving the ultimate comfort brunch/breakfast food...what more can you ask for? 

Decided to stop by for the $3.97 Tuesday to Friday breakfast specials and between the two of us: we split and ordered the biscuits and gravy, the egg croissant with sausage sandwichand the French toast (Texas style) with bacon.
Overall the good quality was as good as breakfast foods come: the croissant was crisp, the hash browns on the side werent soggy or too salty, the eggs were definitely over and easy and the biscuits and gravy....dear lord. Forget all the biscuits and gravy that you've had in all your late night steak and egg experiences because these were the standout and a complete knockout in my opinion.. 
Which made me curious and eager to one  day try out their build your own biscuit sliders. 

Along with our waitress Tracy's sunny disposition, the classic mom and pop owned diner decor (with the classic first dollar bill received: framed), the quality (and price) of the food, the quiet hum of the morning news going off in the background and the occasional crackle of someone whipping open a fresh new newspaper to accompany their coffee---the experience was more than accommodating, satisfying and welcoming. Which in all is extremely important when choosing to dine at breakfast nooks/cafés. Why else would one spend a little more to venture out of bed and pay extra for food that you yourself can easily make your damn self? If not for the convenience, quality and atmosphere? Lol which in this case: biscuits 2 burgers definitely set the tone for a lovely tuesday morning and subsequent Tuesday afternoon. 
Will be back soon :)

I don't get the negative reviews people, high maintenance people, having a bad day or a one off, I guess. The food is great so is the service. I've been here twice and its a restaurant well deserving of your business as stated in other reviews. The biscuits are wonderful so is the gravy. My favorite has been the biscuit sliders. The staff is also very flexible with request to mix and match and accommodate my requests. I hope to return soon.

3 1/2 stars.  

5 of us went over for breakfast; we were tempted by a coupon we received in the mail.  Cute place.  Clean and new; about 15 tables.  

It was an intimate experience, indeed.  There were only two employees; the server, and the cook, and we were the only guests.  

We had an omelette, a waffle, biscuits and gravy, blintzes and a 2 egg breakfast.  The food took a little while since there was only 1 guy cooking it and since it was all made fresh.  Everyone was very pleased with their food.  Absolutely no complaints.  Delicious gravy, eggs cooked perfectly, delightful ingredients in the omelette, etc.  In addition, they have an espresso machine and offer flavored lattes - this pleases me immensely.  

The prices were definitely right - all the meals were around $6 - $7.  We got one freebie with our coupon so we wound up with a bill for $37 for 4 coffees, a latte and 4 breakfasts.  Not bad at all!

I would definitely pop back in for a fresh, tasty, and quiet breakfast.

Sadly I must say the food is not as good as it used to be and service is lacking. Bacon was cool and undercooked, potatoes were dry and over cooked. We had come here before and food was excellent however this time was a completely opposite experience. A note on the service... I spilled a glass of water before we rec'd our food and the entire spilled mess remained on our table for the entire meal!!

Malted waffle rocked, light and fluffy. Not too sweet, just right.  Croissant w/ egg, cheese, tasty sausage, was delicious!  Breakfast potatoes were super flavorful too, nothing was too rich though. Loved it!

The staff is very friendly. I came in on a random workday and the place was very clean and the set up is great... Open kitchen format so you can actually see the goodness that is enroute to your table:) it definitely seemed like they took every consideration to make my meal great. Ordered the breakfast burrito and I was just to my specifications... Hell...the chef was right there! Definitely going back
We had the sirloin and pesto which was real tasty.  Quick in and out for the on-the-go customer.  Thanks again!
So far I've been here twice have only had their biscuit sliders. They are home made and basically made to order. When you come here order at least a side of the biscuits you won't be disappointed!!

So glad we finally tried this place. The food was great! I had the breakfast special-croissant sandwich-and it was so yummy. 

Kid-friendly. My daughter loved the fresh OJ. 

Staff was super sweet and took great care of us.

Reasonable prices.

We will definitely be back!

We've driven by this place all the time. Never wanted to stop in & try it. We saw the sign in the front. Finally one morning we wanted to try a new place. Decided to give this place a try. This tiny little restaurant is amazing! The pumpkin pancakes were delicious. We've found our new breakfast spot! Everyone should try this place at least once. I'd recommend this place to my friends!

found this place on yelp and decided to give it a try, let's put it this way, I was never a fan of scramble eggs, bacon, biscuit, hashbrown for my breakfast, but after coming here, I've completely changed my mind :) I was impressed with how professional their kitchen look, it looks so clean, and I can tell both chef cook with care, they really proud of what they are doing.  They use thick cut bacon and cook to perfection, I've never had bacon that good before, I also love their fresh squeezed orange juice! not to mention GREAT SERVICE TOO.  I'll be coming back from now on, even if it puts a few pound on me after all these food I think it's worth it :)

I was very encouraged to try this place out after reading some previous reviews. I went there with my girlfriend in hopes of uncovering a good local breakfast spot. We ended up ordering the biscuit sliders and the Taylor ham egg sandwich. You build your biscuit sandwich so I asked if I could mix and match. The waitress said I could, so I got one with bacon and cheddar and one with sausage and pepper jack. I got an immediate "wow, so your going to be difficult"...which I was trying to avoid by asking for permission. I don't know if set off the staff by such a rediculous request, but it took us about an hour to get our food. Another couple came in 30 minutes after us and they got their food at the same time we did. We were sitting at the bar watching the chef frantically cooking the entire time, but did not see any food coming out. At no point did anyone come over and apologize for the wait or explain why it took so long, I'm still confused at what happened. On top of that, the waitress doubled charged me for my coffee but we were late and I was set on getting out of there at that point so I didn't even bring it up. 

About 4 tables finished up and left while we were there, none of which were fully cleared off or cleaned. When a new customer came in, the waitress would just pick a table that didn't have left over napkins and cups on it.

I will say that the homemade biscuits were very good and the meal itself was very tasty. Unfortunately due to the extremely poor service there is no way I would ever go back.

Our favorite breakfast place now. Simple but delicious breakfast offerings. Freshly squeezed OJ. I never eat hash brown anywhere but here. The place is cool, clean, inviting. The server is pleasant, very friendly and professional. Service is prompt and efficient. Food is great. 
Only complaint: please change the channel. We always see 'the price is right on their TV

By far the best breakfast in town. It's delicious and very well priced. My personal favorite is the croissant breakfast sandwich but we've also tried their incredible biscuits. 
 The owner is a marathon runner and the entire place is decorated in all of his medals. It is very clean with an open view to the kitchen so you can watch your meal being prepared.

Great coffee!!!!  Great neighborhood place for breakfast at a great price. I had the two egg breakfast.  My over easy eggs were perfect.  The hash browns were crisp and delicious.  My BF got the blueberry waffle special - just the way I like them - Crisp on the outside and tender on the inside.  The fresh squeezed OJ was delicious!  And did I mention the coffee?!?!  Our server was super attentive and sweet.  They have a Friday date night prix fixe menu that we will be trying.  BYOB!

I truly loved the food. I had the Hawaiian burger with sweet potato fries it was amazing. I got a free shake with purchase. Service was wonderful and the decor is so beautiful! Try it you will not be disappointed

I knew this place would be good when I walked in and there were fresh eggs on the kitchen counter! How nice to see that they used real

We came here on a Saturday morning at 9:30 am, and there was hardly anyone here. I found it refreshing that their menu was simple and not not overwhelming. The waitress was super friendly and really good with her suggestions - she pushed us to try the cheddar jalapeno biscuit, and I am so glad we did!

We got the breakfast burrito, turkey bacon, egg whites, coffee, and a biscuit. And YES, the biscuits are fantastic - fresh, hot, soft in the middle. So good! Coffee is great and is served in gigantic mugs so they don't have to bug you a million times to top it off. 

Service was great. Food was great. Atmosphere was great as well. Such a good place to come for a weekend breakfast.

I absolutely will come back for their date night menu. $21.95/person for a set menu, and you are allowed to bring your own beer, wine, etc.

Went here for some breakfast.  Right away, I noticed the staff and service were super friendly.  

The breakfast options are solid.  Prices are reasonable.  Very prompt on the coffee refills.  I brought my family here and we felt well taken care of and very welcome here.  Would recommend if you're looking for a solid, affordable breakfast without the wait.

I ordered the pancake combo and swapped it out for the waffle and a chicken and waffles combo. The waffles were light and sweet , I loved them. The chicken however was seasoned HORRIBLY. When I brought this to the attention of my server she did not respond to me and walked right away ! She then told the cook and came back to inform me it was actually seasoned with thyme and black pepper. I requested it be remade and received no response.
